etymology.description: Semantic 亻(亻) (rén, "person") + Phonetic 尔 (ěr, "you") -> Represents a person you are addressing -> "you"
etymology.interpretation: The character 你(nǐ) combines the person radical 亻(亻) (rén, "person") with the phonetic component 尔 (ěr, "you"), indicating it refers to addressing another person. This compound makes it intuitively clear it means "you" as it involves speaking to another person.

examples.chinese: 如果你愿意(如果你願意)，我们一起去公园(我們一起去公園)。
examples.pinyin: rúguǒ nǐ yuànyì, wǒmen yìqǐ qù gōngyuán。
examples.english: If you are willing, we can go to the park together.

examples.chinese: 见到你(見到你)，我很开心(我很開心)。
examples.pinyin: jiàn dào nǐ, wǒ hěn kāixīn。
examples.english: Seeing you makes me very happy.
